I'm using emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.0.3.zip.

At runtime while executing xpath expression on a DataObject RuntimeException is thrown if a child object is missing. Note that the DataObject is still valid since its schema allowed child object to be absent.
I expect a null value to be returned instead of a NullPointerException.

Similarly, if schema defines an array of child objects (maxOccurences is unlimited), and array element is missing in DataObject an IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

Order object's schema has..
<xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="items" type="bons0:OrderLine" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>

DataObject order; // no items in the order object
order.get("items.0/lineId")

results in
org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList$BasicIndexOutOfBoundsException: index=0, size=0
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.get(BasicEList.java(Compiled Code))
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.get(SDOUtil.java:744)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process(SDOUtil.java:876)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.init(SDOUtil.java:725)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create(SDOUtil.java:645)

	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.get(EDataObjectImpl.java:78)
....

When the schema defines only 0 or 1 occurence of child object, and the DataObject contains no child object, NPE is thrown. Stacktrace is..

	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.EDataObjectImpl.get(EDataObjectImpl.java:78)

Atul,

These aren't XPaths they're SDO paths and they do not behave the way XPaths do.  If you try to index something that's not there, you will get index out of bounds errors and if you try to access a feature that doesn't exist you will get exceptions as well.   So all these cases appear to be bad paths that can't be evaluated and as such should throw an exception; SDO 1.0 doesn't specify what type of exception should be thrown though, so the ones you see will have to suffice.  

This is working as designed (and has been working this way for many years).
